page.title: 19LOCAL FARMING 2.
page.content: Many of the farms have most of thier land for grazing as most keep a variety of stock although in all cases one type of animal is the priority stock. Wheat is grown by most of the farmers on a relatively large scale and all cropgrass for silage making. Despite this enabling the farmers to provide for the stock over winter, the majority still make hay and the traditional shaped bale is the most popular still, with none apparently using the new cylinder shapes now often seen in fields. Most have a considerable range of mechanised equipment e.g. tractors, combine harvesters, balers, ploughs, sprayers, mowers, drills etc., which help enormously in the man hours necessary to work the farms. However each farmer stressed that even in 1985 farming is still very hard work.
